result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcal Miles Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business Monday. 
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
Consecutive to: to 20CM113

miscConds.notes: Payment plan of $20 a month starting on or before 11/1/22 and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.
Payment plan of $20 a month starting on or before 11/1/22 and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.

The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days. 
Def to have NO Contact w/ A.J.M unless determined appropriate by the Department of Corrections with input of A.J.M. after domestic violence programming is successfully completed EXCEPT if a restraining order is in effect, then to follow the terms and conditions of the restraining order
Undergo a Substance Abuse Assmt & comply with all treatment recommendations.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.

Def is to complete individual counseling or group counseling that addresses issues surrounding domestic violence and prevention as directed by the DOC. 
Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcal Miles Long

records.addlTxt: 9:11 AM Defendant Marcal Miles Long in court.  Attorney Vincent Rust appeared by video for Marcal Miles Long.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Cases 20CM113, 22CF63, 22CM22, and 22CT6.  Parties have agreement.  State has complied with victim rights, no response and no restitution request.  Def understands counts and penalties for cases.  Atty, def pleads NO CONTEST.  Atty, def admits acts of domestic abuse.  Files contain PLQ, understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts NO CONTEST pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on information in the criminal complaints, parties agree.  Court finds factual basis exists and finds def GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Def makes statement.  See attached for Sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Atty. Bridget Krause apppeared by video means for Def. Bond covers 20CM113, 22CT6 & New Charges. WARRANT QUASHED. CT finds prob cause on new arrest from 2/22/22 as well. Def comments on bail/bond, cash avail being $250.  CT orders $200 cash bond and NO ABUSIVE CONTACT w/ A.M. Covers all 3 cases where there will be an INIT. CT: Bail does not modify a 72-hour no contact currently in place.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
